alert.note: Alert for Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 7:02PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Starr and southeastern Zapata Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 702 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lopeno, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lopeno, New Falcon and Morales-Sanchez. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 780 and 790. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
